edu.sdsu.watcher.quake

Class SimpleEarthquake

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.sdsu.watcher.quake.SimpleEarthquake

  • public class SimpleEarthquake
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the details of getting the data from the remote or local resource, filtering the data, and returning the user with usable data. Uses OkHttpClient to handle the specific of the Http requests.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleEarthquake()
      Reads live data from the USGS website.
      SimpleEarthquake(boolean cacheFile, java.lang.String location)

      Construct a new Object with caching ability.
      SimpleEarthquake(java.io.File file)
      Reads a local file and uses cached data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleEarthquake

        public SimpleEarthquake()
        Reads live data from the USGS website.

      • SimpleEarthquake

        public SimpleEarthquake(boolean cacheFile,
                        java.lang.String location)
        Parameters:
        cacheFile - Set true to cache the downloaded geojson file.
        location - The path of the file without the file (this will be created automatically).
        See Also:
        SimpleEarthquake(boolean, String, boolean)

      • SimpleEarthquake

        public SimpleEarthquake(boolean cacheFile,
                        java.lang.String location,
                        boolean appendTimestamp)

        Construct a new Object with caching ability. If you don't need the ability to cacheFile then usage of this constructor is discouraged – use getEarthquakes() for live data or use

        Note: This constructor will first gather the live data once getEarthquakes(String, String) is called and then save the json data in the location specified. Sample usage:

             SimpleEarthquake test = new SimpleEarthquake(true, "/home/foo/Desktop");
     List<Earthquake> quakes = test.getEarthquakes("all", "hour");
        SimpleEarthquake(File) to read from an existing cacheFile.
        Parameters:
        cacheFile - Set true to cache the downloaded geojson file.
        location - The path of the file without the file (this will be created automatically).
        appendTimestamp - Set true to append the timestamp to the name of the Cache file.

      • SimpleEarthquake

        public SimpleEarthquake(java.io.File file)
        Reads a local file and uses cached data.
        Parameters:
        file - the cached json file to read from.

    • Method Detail

      • getEarthquakes

        public java.util.List<Earthquake> getEarthquakes(java.lang.String threshold,
                                                 java.lang.String time)

        Gets a list of earthquakes found within the given threshold and time.

        Acceptable units for threshold are:

        • significant
        • all
        • 4.5
        • 2.5
        • 1.0

        Acceptable units for time are:

        • month
        • week
        • day
        • hour
        Parameters:
        threshold - the threshold to filter by.
        time - the time to filer by.
        Returns:
        a list of earthquakes or an empty list if none are found.

      • getEarthquakes

        public java.util.List<Earthquake> getEarthquakes()

        Gets a list of all earthquakes found within a week time frame.

        Returns:
        a list of earthquakes or an empty list if none are found.
        See Also:
        getEarthquakes(String, String)
